reviews.review_msg: Came here before signing up and the exams and not easy/fair... the multichoice is REALLY hard and could be based on any one unimportant sentence in the 300 plus pages of content for test. Written based on main concepts though and evens it out. Only take if you REALLY want to. She is quiet and a bit boring. TA marks fast and well. Text entensive.

I LOVE this class, for someone who is interested in mental disorders/abnormal psych, u will love this. The prof tells us stories about her clients because she works as a therapist too, and they're so interesting. She is clear, the exams FAIR. Plays interesting videos like from Modern Family, relevant to course. Best 200 level course imo. I love her
Wow boring and impossible to understand

It was really helpful that she was organized especially when classes transitioned online during covid-19. All her lectures are straightforward and her exams are a mix of lecture and textbook material.
Whoever marks the assignments and tests does a horrible job. They will change (e.g lower) your grade for an assignment and never give you a clear answer why. This class dropped my GPA. Never again.

Lectures are dull and she makes no attempts to shorten them by screening irrelevant material. Instead, she will try to add pointless discussions and videos. Tries to trick students on exams and will maybe give you a one sentence email in response to a concern.  Sometimes seems to be talking down to students

Lovely prof. I enjoyed her lectures a lot. I loved that she tried to have class discussions in such a big class. The exams cover everything from lec an d text, just keep with the material and you will do fine. The only thing that annoyed me sometimes was the amount of videos she showed in lecture towards the end of the semester.

Great prof! Tells you exactly what's on the 2 midterms and even breaks down the cumulative portion for the finals. Lecture slides (WebCT) are basically the focus of the course.. no surprises for any of the exams.

Really good instructor, funny, gives good examples and the lectures are interesting and never boring.  Gives good examples.  Tests are a little hard with a usual average of 66%, also he doesn't have office hours so hard to track down.

She's really great and nice! She's like a friend more than a professor (a really smart friend). When you ask questions she will answer them and if you're shy just ask through her email. Her tone of voice, her body language, her teaching style is very comforting and really removes the stress from a course. It was a great course taking it wit her

I really enjoyed taking 241 with Sarah. I feel like she improved a lot from the beginning to the end of the course. Her exams were straight forward and her lectures were enjoyable. Exams are mostly based off lecture but important to skim textbook for additional info. Has a good sense of humour and is a kind and approachable prof :)
